perturbation.original_text: 8.2 Development and Commercial Milestone Payments. Vyera shall pay each of the following non-refundable, non-creditable payments to CytoDyn upon achievement of each of the following events with respect to the Licensed Product. Each milestone payment by Vyera pursuant to this Section 8.2 shall be payable only one time.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.2 Development and Commercial Milestone Payments. Vyera shall pay each of the following non-refundable, non-creditable payments to CytoDyn upon achievement of each of the following events with respect to the Licensed Product. Each milestone payment by Vyera pursuant to this Section 8.2 shall be payable multiple times as milestones are achieved for each subsequent indication.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by changing the payment terms in different sections of the contract. The original text states that each milestone payment is payable only one time, however, the modified text states that milestone payments are payable multiple times as milestones are achieved for each subsequent indication. This creates uncertainty regarding which terms should be enforced, leading to disputes over contractual obligations.

perturbation.original_text: 8.12 Late Payment. All payments due to a Party under this Agreement shall be made in U.S. Dollars by wire transfer of immediately available funds into an account designated by the receiving Party. If a Party does not receive payment of any sum due to it on or before the due date, simple interest shall thereafter accrue on the sum due to such Party until the date of payment at the per annum rate of two percent (2%) over the then prime rate quoted by Citibank in New York City or the maximum rate allowable by Applicable Law, whichever is lower.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.12 Late Payment. All payments due to a Party under this Agreement shall be made in U.S. Dollars by wire transfer of immediately available funds into an account designated by the receiving Party. If a Party does not receive payment of any sum due to it on or before the due date, no interest will accrue on the sum due to such Party unless the amount is over $1,000,000, in which case, simple interest shall thereafter accrue on the sum due to such Party until the date of payment at the per annum rate of ten percent (10%) over the then prime rate quoted by Citibank in New York City or the maximum rate allowable by Applicable Law, whichever is higher.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction. The original text states that simple interest shall accrue on any sum due to a Party if payment is not received on time, whereas the modified text states that interest only accrues if the amount is over $1,000,000. This creates an inconsistency in how late payments are handled depending on the amount, which was previously not a condition.

perturbation.original_text: 11.4 Termination for Material Breach. Either Party (the “Non-Breaching Party”) may terminate this Agreement in the event the other Party (the “Breaching Party”) commits a material breach of this Agreement, and such material breach (excluding breaches of payment obligations) has not been cured within [***] after receipt of written notice of such breach by the Breaching Party from the Non-Breaching Party (the “Cure Period”). The Cure Period shall be [***] after receipt of written notice of such breach by the Breaching Party from the Non-Breaching Party for breaches of payment obligations (except with respect to Section 8.13, which is covered by Section 11.3(d) above). The written notice describing the alleged material breach shall provide sufficient detail to put the Breaching Party on notice of such material breach.
perturbation.changed_text: 11.4 Termination for Material Breach. Either Party (the “Non-Breaching Party”) may terminate this Agreement in the event the other Party (the “Breaching Party”) commits a material breach of this Agreement, and such material breach (including breaches of payment obligations) has not been cured within [***] after receipt of written notice of such breach by the Breaching Party from the Non-Breaching Party (the “Cure Period”). The Cure Period shall be [***] after receipt of written notice of such breach by the Breaching Party from the Non-Breaching Party for breaches of payment obligations (except with respect to Section 8.13, which is covered by Section 11.3(d) above). The written notice describing the alleged material breach shall provide sufficient detail to put the Breaching Party on notice of such material breach.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces an in-text contradiction regarding what breaches of the agreement the cure period applies to. The original text states that the cure period does not apply to breaches of payment obligations, whereas the modified text has the cure period apply to such breaches. This creates an inconsistency in the agreement.
